intro: Cambessedesia cinnabarina, commonly known as the scarlet sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as deserts and grasslands. Cambessedesia cinnabarina plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
